_header: I which that am sorrowfullest man
_description: An Amorous Complaint (Compleint Damours), sometimes attributed to Chaucer — thirteen stanzas rhyme royal

Bod638.First Lines:
I which that am the sorwefullist manThat in this worlde was euyr
                    yit leuynge…
Bod638.Last Lines:
…And yit wull I euyrmore hir serueAnd loue hir best although
                    she do me sterue
Bod638.Attributed Author:
be me humffrey fflemyng (after Explicit, not in scribe’s
                    hand)
Bod638.Facsimiles:
Robinson,  Pamela. 
             “Introduction.” 
             Manuscript Bodley 638: A Facsimile.
         Norman, OK: Pilgrim, and Woodbridge: Boydell and Brewer, 1982.

BodFair16.First Lines:
I whiche that am the sorwfullest manThat in this worlde was euer
                    yet lyvinge…
BodFair16.Last Lines:
…And yet wol I euer more hir serueAnd loue hir best al thogh
                    she do me sterue
BodFair16.Facsimiles:
Norton-Smith,  John. 
             “Introduction.” 
             Bodleian Library MS Fairfax 16.
         London: Scolar Press, 1979.

BLHar7333.First Lines:
I which þat am þe sorowfullest manÞat in this worlde
                    was euere yit leving…
BLHar7333.Last Lines:
…And yit wolle I euermore hir serveAnd love hir best all
                    thowhe sheo do me sterue
BLHar7333.Attributed Title:
And next folowyng begynnith an amorowse / compleynte made at wyndesore in
                    the laste / May to fore nouembre (f. 135vb, rubric)
